meanings.definition: A Chinese puzzle consisting of a square cut into seven pieces that can be arranged to make various other shapes.
meanings.sent1: During the game, she solved the tangram by fitting the pieces together.
meanings.sent2: The children enjoyed playing with the tangram, creating different shapes.
meanings.sent3: At the party, they used the tangram pieces to build a tiny house for the ants.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a tangram of thoughts, each piece fitting perfectly into place.
meanings.sent5: The tangram challenge was to recreate the Eiffel Tower using the seven pieces.

meanings.definition: A puzzle consisting of a square divided into seven pieces that can be arranged to form various shapes.
meanings.sent1: He spent hours trying to solve the tangram, rearranging the pieces repeatedly.
meanings.sent2: The tangram puzzle required careful manipulation of the shapes to fit together.
meanings.sent3: The cat knocked over the tangram pieces, creating a chaotic mess on the floor.
meanings.sent4: Her life felt like a tangram, with different pieces coming together to form a beautiful picture.
